title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: burgh ; so that all the current engagements werapaid without the least check to the circulation oftheir notes, or inconvenience to poor or rich, whohappened to have them in possession. The UnionBank of Falkirk also became insolvent within thesefifteen years, but paid up its engagements withoutmuch loss to the creditors. Other cases there mayhave occurred not coming within my recollection ;but I think none which made any great sensation,or could at all affect the general confidence of thecountry in the stability of the system.
